verses.plain: Hear me your father, O children, and do thereafter, that ye may be safe.

tokens.t: Hear me your father, O children, and do thereafter, that ye may be safe.

verses.plain: For the Lord hath given the father honour over the children, and hath confirmed the authority of the mother over the sons.

tokens.t: For the Lord hath given the father honour over the children, and hath confirmed the authority of the mother over the sons.

verses.plain: Whoso honoureth his father maketh an atonement for his sins:

tokens.t: Whoso honoureth his father maketh an atonement for his sins:

verses.plain: And he that honoureth his mother is as one that layeth up treasure.

tokens.t: And he that honoureth his mother is as one that layeth up treasure.

verses.plain: Whoso honoureth his father shall have joy of his own children; and when he maketh his prayer, he shall be heard.

tokens.t: Whoso honoureth his father shall have joy of his own children; and when he maketh his prayer, he shall be heard.

verses.plain: He that honoureth his father shall have a long life; and he that is obedient unto the Lord shall be a comfort to his mother.

tokens.t: He that honoureth his father shall have a long life; and he that is obedient unto the Lord shall be a comfort to his mother.

verses.plain: He that feareth the Lord will honour his father, and will do service unto his parents, as to his masters.

tokens.t: He that feareth the Lord will honour his father, and will do service unto his parents, as to his masters.

verses.plain: Honour thy father and mother both in word and deed, that a blessing may come upon thee from them.

tokens.t: Honour thy father and mother both in word and deed, that a blessing may come upon thee from them.

verses.plain: For the blessing of the father establisheth the houses of children; but the curse of the mother rooteth out foundations.

tokens.t: For the blessing of the father establisheth the houses of children; but the curse of the mother rooteth out foundations.

verses.plain: Glory not in the dishonour of thy father; for thy father’s dishonour is no glory unto thee.

tokens.t: Glory not in the dishonour of thy father; for thy father’s dishonour is no glory unto thee.

verses.plain: For the glory of a man is from the honour of his father; and a mother in dishonour is a reproach to the children.

tokens.t: For the glory of a man is from the honour of his father; and a mother in dishonour is a reproach to the children.

verses.plain: My son, help thy father in his age, and grieve him not as long as he liveth.

tokens.t: My son, help thy father in his age, and grieve him not as long as he liveth.

verses.plain: And if his understanding fail, have patience with him; and despise him not when thou art in thy full strength.

tokens.t: And if his understanding fail, have patience with him; and despise him not when thou art in thy full strength.

verses.plain: For the relieving of thy father shall not be forgotten: and instead of sins it shall be added to build thee up.

tokens.t: For the relieving of thy father shall not be forgotten: and instead of sins it shall be added to build thee up.

verses.plain: In the day of thine affliction it shall be remembered; thy sins also shall melt away, as the ice in the fair warm weather.

tokens.t: In the day of thine affliction it shall be remembered; thy sins also shall melt away, as the ice in the fair warm weather.

verses.plain: He that forsaketh his father is as a blasphemer; and he that angereth his mother is cursed: of God.

tokens.t: He that forsaketh his father is as a blasphemer; and he that angereth his mother is cursed: of God.

verses.plain: My son, go on with thy business in meekness; so shalt thou be beloved of him that is approved.

tokens.t: My son, go on with thy business in meekness; so shalt thou be beloved of him that is approved.

verses.plain: The greater thou art, the more humble thyself, and thou shalt find favour before the Lord.

tokens.t: The greater thou art, the more humble thyself, and thou shalt find favour before the Lord.

verses.plain: Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek.

tokens.t: Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek.

verses.plain: For the power of the Lord is great, and he is honoured of the lowly.

tokens.t: For the power of the Lord is great, and he is honoured of the lowly.

verses.plain: Seek not out things that are too hard for thee, neither search the things that are above thy strength.

tokens.t: Seek not out things that are too hard for thee, neither search the things that are above thy strength.

verses.plain: But what is commanded thee, think thereupon with reverence, for it is not needful for thee to see with thine eyes the things that are in secret.

tokens.t: But what is commanded thee, think thereupon with reverence, for it is not needful for thee to see with thine eyes the things that are in secret.

verses.plain: Be not curious in unnecessary matters: for more things are shewed unto thee than men understand.

tokens.t: Be not curious in unnecessary matters: for more things are shewed unto thee than men understand.

verses.plain: For many are deceived by their own vain opinion; and an evil suspicion hath overthrown their judgment.

tokens.t: For many are deceived by their own vain opinion; and an evil suspicion hath overthrown their judgment.

verses.plain: Without eyes thou shalt want light: profess not the knowledge therefore that thou hast not.

tokens.t: Without eyes thou shalt want light: profess not the knowledge therefore that thou hast not.

verses.plain: A stubborn heart shall fare evil at the last; and he that loveth danger shall perish therein.

tokens.t: A stubborn heart shall fare evil at the last; and he that loveth danger shall perish therein.

verses.plain: An obstinate heart shall be laden with sorrows; and the wicked man shall heap sin upon sin.

tokens.t: An obstinate heart shall be laden with sorrows; and the wicked man shall heap sin upon sin.

verses.plain: In the punishment of the proud there is no remedy; for the plant of wickedness hath taken root in him.

tokens.t: In the punishment of the proud there is no remedy; for the plant of wickedness hath taken root in him.

verses.plain: The heart of the prudent will understand a parable; and an attentive ear is the desire of a wise man.

tokens.t: The heart of the prudent will understand a parable; and an attentive ear is the desire of a wise man.

verses.plain: Water will quench a flaming fire; and alms maketh an atonement for sins.

tokens.t: Water will quench a flaming fire; and alms maketh an atonement for sins.

verses.plain: And he that requiteth good turns is mindful of that which may come hereafter; and when he falleth, he shall find a stay.

tokens.t: And he that requiteth good turns is mindful of that which may come hereafter; and when he falleth, he shall find a stay.
